poem:
Title: "Climate's Orphaned Throne"

Throw not a shadow, Sunak, on the earth's plight,
By concealing green policies in political night.
To whose hand shall the sceptre of change belong,
If not for Deben, in the Committee's song?
For a year and a half the chair stands empty,
A missing voice in nature's symphony.
Let the chime of change ring loud and clear,
Before the echo of silence, we fear.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Sunak ‘dodging scrutiny’ by failing to appoint chair of Climate Change Committee Rishi Sunak has been accused of trying to avoid scrutiny of his green policies after details surfaced about his government’s failure, over more than 18 months, to appoint a new chair of the independent climate change committee. Senior environmentalists said they believed Sunak may be deliberately trying to avoid appointing a successor to Lord Deben – who first announced that he was stepping". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
